title: Mixed Vegetables Kadai 👌 |Side Dish | Restaurant Style | Breakfast/ Dinner | Enjoy with Naan / Roti 😋
content:
Side Dish: Gravy Curry : Mixed Vegetable Kadai 👌 Servings: 3 Kadai's Duration: 40 mins Curry is either wet/ dry prepared out of vegetables/ leafy vegetables. It should be cooked and make sure it contain some amount of nutrients in it for good health diet. Side dish is common for any Indian meal but varies the method or process from state to state. Previously, I had posted many curries as you liked them and motivated, so I thought to make a healthy curry tho it's delicious which is Mixed Vegetables Kadai 😍 I'm presenting you a popular and succulent Gravy curry for Naan/ Roti/ Rice / Phulka.. Taste absolutely makes you mesmerize and it loaded with full of vegetables. They are cauliflower, potatoes, carrot, beans, capsicum etc., all these vegetables are half cooked because I would like to protect nutrients which helps you can eat a healthy food. I clearly explained how to make veggies half cooked in below section so they remain good in taste and healthy too. I like most of vegetable gravy Kadai but mixed vegetables Kadai 😋 I'm out of words I love this Kadai a lot you should prepare and must taste it once I'm sure you fall in love with this mixed Vegetables Kadai ☺️ Today I prepared Gravy curry with full of vegetables , spices and fresh heavy cream. To make it you need lots of patience and at the end of curry I hope you will definitely enjoy your Kadai Let's start with ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients: Mixed Vegetables:
  • Cauliflower - Florets - 20
  • Beans - 15 - chopped - 1 inch
  • Carrots - 1 - chopped - 1 inch
  • Potatoes - 2 - medium - diced
  • Green peas - 1/4 cup - frozen
  • Capsicum/ Green Bell pepper - 1 - petals
  • Paneer - 8 pieces - diced (Fry in Butter & Keep aside)
Gravy:
  • Onion - 1 - medium - diced
  • Tomatoes - 2 - medium - diced
  • Green chillies - 4 - chopped
  • Ginger - 2 tb sp - chopped
  • Ginger - peel off - 3 cloves - chopped
  • Cashew nuts - 6 to 7 - soaked ( 20 mins )
Spices:
  • Red chilly powder - 1/2 tb sp
  • Coriander powder - 1 tb sp
  • Garam masala - 1 tsp
  • Kasuri Methi / Dry fenugreek leaves - 1 tb sp
  • Turmeric powder - 1/4 tsp
  • Salt - 1 tb sp
Other:
  • Cloves - 1
  • Cinnamon stick - 2 - small pieces
  • Bay leaf - 1
  • Fresh cream - 80 ml
  • Coriander Leaves - 1/2 cup
  • Oil - 3 tb sp
Procedure: Prepreparation: Gravy:
  • Heat pan over medium heat
  • Add 1/2 tb sp oil
  • Add all gravy ingredients except cashew nuts
  • Saute 5 mins
  • Keep it aside & Let it become cool
  • Add in mixer grinder and make smooth paste along with cashew nuts
  • Add 1 cup of water when blending
  • Keep gravy aside
Half cooked Vegetables:
  • Heat skillet pan over low to medium heat
  • Add 1/2 tb sp oil
  • Add all vegetables
  • Saute 1 min
  • Cook 5 to 7 mins by closing with a lid
  • Take out veggies in a plate
  • Let them become cool
  • Keep it aside
Process of making Mixed Vegetables Kadai :
  • Heat Pan over medium heat
  • Add rest of the oil
  • Add cloves, cinnamon & bay leaf
  • Saute and add red chilly powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, Garam Masala and salt
  • Saute 30 secs
  • Add Gravy
  • Mix well
  • Cook 2 mins
  • Add half cooked Vegetables
  • Mix well
  • Cook 3 mins
  • Add fresh cream & Mix well
  • Turn off heat / Cooktop
  • Add kasuri methi and coriander leaves
  • Mix well
  • Close with lid for 10 mins, so that flavours will be set to curry
  • Serve Mixed Vegetables Kadai with any chapathi/ phulka/ Naan/ Roti
  • Happy Cooking & Enjoy your day 😊
Step by step process shown below with pictures: Note:
  • Adjust spices according to taste
  • Paneer & coriander leaves optional
  • If you don't have fresh cream you can use milk
  • Perserves upto 3 days in refrigerator ( airtight container )
Checkout my other Gravy curry for Roti / Naan:
  • Spinach-peas Gravy / Palak Mutter Creamy Kadai
  • Cauliflower/Gobi Butter Masala || Side Dish || Restaurant Style 🙂

title: Spring Onions Paratha 😋/ Ulli kadala roti || Breakfast/ Dinner
content:
Spring Onions Paratha: Breakfast/ Dinner Servings: 6 Duration: 30 mins Paratha is a flatbread originated from North India 🇮🇳 it is a special breakfast for Indians such as Punjabi’s in Punjab and also in Gujarat simply I can say it’s completely North Indian dish. Now a days it’s popular all over India and also serving in Indian restaurants and easy to prepare at home in ample time. There are many types of Paratha’s which can be prepared with Wheat flour/ Atta/ Maida/ all purpose flour and veggies for stuffing. It can also prepared with leafy vegetables such as Fenugreek leaves, spinach etc., and also combination of palak paneer, aloo paneer Paratha, Aloo Methi paratha like this wise you can make so many varieties of paratha’s. Mostly it is prepared at breakfast time, you should have paratha’s when they are hot because it tastes delicious 😋 Mainly, it’s cooked with ghee/ butter/ cooking oil and serve with Raita/ curd and any kind of pickle (Indian pickles) Today I prepared Paratha with spring onions with spices. Nutrition facts: Spring onions: Vitamins A & C, Minerals iron, calcium, potassium, magnesium, fiber & protein Ajwain seeds: It contains only minerals such as protein, sodium and a dietary fiber with less cholesterol and good saturated fat. Health Benefits of Ajwain:
  1. Instant relief from acidity and digestion
  2. Treats common cold
  3. Stops pain due to arthritis
  4. Cleansing skin
  5. To ease the ache of ear and teeth
  6. It makes stomach strong during pregnancy
  7. For mouth problems
  8. Fights with asthma
  9. Acts for viral infections and diarrhea
  10. Best for migraine
Let's start with ingredients and follows Procedure: Ingredients:
  • Wheat Flour - 350 gms
  • Spring onions - 4 shallots - finely chopped
  • Red chilly powder - 1 tsp
  • Red chilly flakes - 1 tsp
  • Ajwain / carom seeds - 1 tsp
  • Turmeric powder - 1/4 tsp
  • Salt - 1 tsp
  • Oil - 1 tb sp
  • Water - 150 ml
  • Ghee/ oil / Butter - 3 tb sp - to cook Paratha
Procedure:
  • In a mixing bowl and wheat flour, chopped spring onions, salt, Ajwain/ carom seeds, red chilly powder, red chilly flakes & turmeric powder
  • Mix well
  • Add water and make perfect non sticky dough
  • Close with lid
  • Rest for 15-20 mins
  • After 20 mins Add 1 spoon oil and knead
  • Divide dough into equal parts
  • Make round balls
  • Heat tawa over medium heat
  • Take a dough ball and dust some flour
  • Roll it towards upwards and downwards to make round shape
  • Put rolled spring Onion Paratha on tawa
  • Flip roti when bubbling started
  • Apply oil
  • Cook both sides equally by applying oil
  • Serve immediately with Gravy curry
  • Happy cooking & Enjoy your Day 😊
Step by step process shown below with pictures: Note:
  • Adjust spices according to taste
  • Double the quantity to increase the quantity of Paratha/ roti
  • To cook Paratha, Instead of oil You can also use butter / ghee
Checkout my other paratha recipes:
  • Radish Paratha / Mooli Paratha / Mulangi Paratha
  • Methi Paratha/ Fenugreek leaves Paratha || Punjabi Style
  • Palak Paratha/ Spinach Paratha || Indian Bread || Breakfast/ Dinner
  • Aloo Methi Paratha 🙂 / Potato Fenugreek leaves Paratha || Indian Flat Bread|| Breakfast/ Dinner
  • Paneer Paratha 😀 || Paneer Stuffed Paratha Breakfast / Dinner || Indian Flat Bread

title: Potlakaya Kura / Snack Gourd with Dal || Side Dish || No Onion-Garlic Recipe || Breakfast/ Lunch
content:
Side dish: Roti / Rice : South India Servings: 4 Duration:  20 mins Any Indian meal contains Dal, curry, rice, roti and curd it's so authentic and traditional to have a meal with curries and it gives you so much satisfaction with happiness. All these curries which I was prepared are the same process following from many generations and learnt from others like grand-grand parents. It's like a chain process and love to know more and more from grand parents. Curry is a side dish either wet/ dry prepared out of vegetables/ leafy vegetables. It should be cooked and make sure it contain some amount of nutrients in it for good health diet. You can dip roti in curry and eat, you feel the flavours of it really delicious 😋 In South India it’s common recipe and should be a side dish in every meal, this Dal suits with any rice/jeera rice/ fresh hot rice with ghee if you like to have it with any phulka/ Roti then it’s great combination 👍 Coming to Recipe, I don't know how many of you know Bottle Gourd or tasted it or love this vegetable, but I like this a lot in any form either it could be fry, stir fry, curry or mix in Dal. If anyone of you doesn't taste yet must try! Today I prepared Dal with snake gourd and it is a no onion garlic recipe, if you're in vrat / pooja , you can have it nicely. Nutrition facts: Snake Gourd:  Vitamins A & C. Minerals iron , calcium, potassium and sodium Bengal Gram: Vitamins B6. Minerals iron , calcium, potassium, magnesium, fiber, protein and sodium Let's start with Ingredients and follows Procedure: Ingredients:
  • Snake Gourd/ Potlakaya - 1 - medium - peeled off - diced
  • Bengal gram - 80 gms - soak for 30 mins
  • Tomatoes 🍅 - 2 - medium - Diced
  • Turmeric powder - 1/4 tsp
  • Red chilly powder - 1/2 tb sp
  • Coriander powder -  1/4 cup
  • Fresh grated coconut - 6 tb sp
  • Green chillies - 4 - Slices
  • Salt - 1/2 tb sp
For Tempering:
  • Mustard seeds/ Avvalu - 1 tea spoon
  • Cumin seeds/ Jeera - 1 tea spoon
  • Urad dal/ Minapappu - 1 tea spoon
  • Curry leaves - 4 to 5
  • Oil - 1 tb sp
Procedure:
  • Heat cooker over low to medium heat
  • Add oil
  • Add tempering
  • Let them splutter
  • Add tomatoes & Saute 1 min
  • Add spices, salt and turmeric powder
  • Add soaked Dal & chopped snake Gourd
  • Saute and add 2 cups of water
  • Close the cooker with lid and whistle
  • Cook for 3 whistles over medium heat
  • Let it become cool
  • Open cooker and it's cooked well
  • Mash gently with masher
  • Add chopped coriander leaves
  • Mix well
  • Potlakaya Kura ready to serve
  • Serve it with rice / roti
  • Happy cooking & enjoy your day 🙂
Step by step process shown below with pictures:   Note:
  • Adjust spices according to taste
  • Double the ingredients to Increase the quantity
  • Perserve upto 3 days in refrigerator ( i think you would finish it before ☺️ )
  • If you don't like or don't find snake gourd, you can replace it with Bottle Gourd/ Potato 🥔
  • No onion garlic recipe
  • If you would like have it with onion & garlic. You can add 1/2 diced onion & 2 chopped cloves, add these two after tempering ☺️
  • Hope you like it
Checkout my side dish recipes:
  • Chikkudukaya Talimpu/ Broad Beans Stir Fry || Side Dish || Lunch / Dinner
  • Sorakaya Majjiga Pulusu 😋 / Bottle Gourd Curry with yogurt || Side dish || Lunch
  • Cauliflower/Gobi Butter Masala || Side Dish || Restaurant Style 🙂
  • Ivy Gourd fry/ Dondakaya fry/ Tindora fry
  • Cabbage Stir Fry || Side Dish || Rice / Roti
  • Spinach Stir Fry || South Indian Style

title: Tomato 🍅 Chutney's - 3 Ways | Side Dish | Breakfast
content:
Side Dish: Breakfast: South India 🇮🇳  In Indian breakfast recipes there must be a tasty side dish which varies from one breakfast to another, some of the side dishes suits to more than 3 breakfast recipes. For example coconut chutney goes well with plain Dosa, onion uttapam, Idly , Poori etc., You can checkout my Coriander Coconut Chutney / Kothimeera Kobbari Chutney Like wise, mostly South Indian breakfast dishes should serve with any flavoured side dish. So today I would like to share three different chutney's they are  simple to make and perfect combination for any South Indian breakfast recipes. Today I prepared three tomato chutney 🍅 with other spices . Let's start with Ingredients and follows Procedure Duration : 30 mins Prepreparation: ( Basic step to all Chutney's ) Step 1:
  •  Heat pan add chopped tomatoes 🍅 and cook 4 - 5 minutes
  • Keep it aside
Step 2: ( Common for all Chutney's ) For Tempering: Mustard seeds/ Avvalu - 1 tea spoon Cumin seeds/ Jeera - 1 tea spoon Curry leaves - 6 Oil - 1 tb sp
  • Heat a tempering pan over medium heat
  • Add oil
  • Add mustard seeds and cumin seeds
  • Let them splutter
  • Next add curry leaves 🍃
  • Saute & turn off heat
  • Keep it aside
Tomato Peanuts 🥜 Chutney: Ingredients:
  • Tomatoes - 1 - medium - diced
  • Roasted Peanuts - 1/3 cup - 80gms
  • Green chillies - 3 - chopped
  • Salt - 1 tsp
Procedure:
  • Heat pan add tomatoes and cook 5 mins
  • Keep it aside
  • In another pan add oil & add chopped green chillies
  • Saute 1 min & Keep it aside
  • Let them become cool
  • Add cooked tomatoes, roasted peanuts, green chillies and salt in mixer grinder
  • Blend till smooth paste
  • If required Add little water to make smooth paste
  • Take out chutney in a bowl
  • Add prepared tempering on chutney
  • Serve it with any breakfast especially South Indian breakfast such as Idly,
  • Plain Dosa
  • Onion 🥕 Uttapam
  • Ghee Podi Masala Dosa😋|| Breakfast|| Restaurant Style
  • Green gram Dosa/ Pesara Attu/ Moong Dal Dosa
  • Chapathi/ Roti
Step by step shown below with pictures:   Garlic Tomato 🍅Chutney: Ingredients:
  • Tomatoes - 2 - medium - diced
  • Garlic cloves - 4 - medium - peeled off & chopped
  • Red chilly powder - 1/2 tb sp
  • Salt - 1 tsp
  • Tamarind extract - 1/2 inch piece
  • Jaggery Powder - 1/2 tb sp
Procedure:
  • Heat pan add tomatoes, garlic, red chilly powder,tamarind extract, salt and cook 5 mins
  • Keep it aside
  • Let them become cool
  • Add cooked tomatoes with garlic and other spices in mixer grinder
  • Blend till smooth paste
  • If required Add little water to make smooth paste
  • Take out chutney in a bowl
  • Add prepared tempering on chutney
  • Serve it with any breakfast ( Breakfast links mentioned above )
Step by step process shown below with pictures: Onion Tomato 🍅 Chutney: Ingredients:
  • Tomato - 1 - medium - diced
  • Onion - 1 - small - diced
  • Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Cumin seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Urad Dal - 1 tsp
  • Bengal gram - 1 tsp
  • Fenugreek seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Oil - 1/2 tb sp
  • Salt - 1 tsp
  • Green chillies - 3 - chopped
Procedure:
  • Heat pan over medium heat
  • Add oil, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, Urad Dal, Bengal gram, fenugreek seeds, curry leaves, green chillies
  • Let them splutter
  • Add onions and chopped tomatoes
  • Cook 5 mins
  • Keep it aside
  • Let them become cool
  • Add cooked tomatoes and onion with ingredients in mixer grinder
  • Blend till smooth paste
  • If required Add little water to make smooth paste
  • Take out chutney in a bowl
  • Add prepared tempering on chutney
  • Serve it with any breakfast ( Breakfast recipes link mentioned above )
Step by step process shown below with pictures: Note:
  • Adjust Spices and salt according to taste
  • Double the ingredients to increase quantity
  • Contains peanuts & garlic
  • In tomato peanuts Chutney I used whole peanuts with skin. If you doesn't like you can remove skin on peanuts and then add in blender
  • These chutney's can preserve in refrigerator for 3 days
  • If you are storing in refrigerator, store chutney in an airtight container
Checkout my other Breakfast Recipes:
  • Masala Dosa
  • Rice flour Roti/ Chawal ki Roti
  • Veg Hakka Noodles 🍝|| Breakfast / Dinner
  • Healthy & Tasty Vegetable Vermicelli Upma
  • Adai Dosa/ Lentils Dosa 😋 || Breakfast

title: Chikkudukaya Talimpu/ Broad Beans Stir Fry || Side Dish || Lunch / Dinner
content:
Side Dish: Lunch - Rice / Dinner - Chapathi/ Roti Servings - 4 Duration: 30 mins Curry is either wet/ dry prepared out of vegetables/ leafy vegetables. It should be cooked and make sure it contain some amount of nutrients in it for good health diet. In South India it's common recipe and should be a side dish in every meal, this Broad beans curry suits with any dal rice/ fresh hot rice with ghee if you like to have it with any phulka/ Roti then it's great combination 👍 The masala ingredients which I used in this curry is basic for almost all vegetable curries. If you don't have much then ground coconut and green chillies paste together, store it in an refrigerator and use on cooked veggies as and when required. It doesn't consume much time. This basic mild spicy masala goes well with French beans, carrots, lady's finger, Cluster beans etc., Nutrition facts: Broad Beans: Vitamins A,C & B6. Minerals iron, calcium, magnesium, potassium, fiber, sodium & protein Today I prepared Broad beans curry which is simple and obviously yummy 😋 Let's start with ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients:
  • Broad Beans - 1/2 kg - chopped
  • Red onion / White Onion - 1 medium - chopped
  • Fresh grated coconut - 1/3 cup
  • Green chillies - 4
  • Salt - 1 1/2 tsp
  • Turmeric powder - 1/4 tsp
  • Coriander leaves - 1/3 cup - chopped
For Tempering:
  • Mustard seeds/ Avvalu - 1/2 tea spoon
  • Cumin seeds/ Jeera - 1/2 tea spoon
  • Urad dal/ Minapappu - 1 tea spoon
  • Bengal gram/ Senagapappu - 1 tea spoon
  • Curry leaves - 4 to 5
  • Oil - 1 tb sp
Procedure: Prepreparation:
  • Wash broad beans twice under running water
  • Check the beans are clean and fresh
  • Chop them 1/2 inch size
  • Cook them on steam, add turmeric powder and 1/2 tsp salt for 20 mins
  • After 20 mins broad beans cooked well
Process of making Broad beans stir fry:
  • Heat skillet pan over medium heat
  • Add oil, tempering and onions
  • Saute 1 min
  • Meanwhile blend coconut & green chillies in mixer grinder
  • Keep it aside
  • Onions are tender and little bit crunchy
  • Now add cooked Broad beans
  • Saute and add grounded coconut paste & salt
  • Mix well and saute 2 mins
  • Turnoff heat and add chopped coriander leaves
  • Mix well and dish out
  • Serve Broad Beans stir fry with Dal rice/ Roti / Plain white rice / Brown rice
  • Happy cooking and enjoy your day 😊
Step by step process shown below with pictures: Note:
  • Adjust the spices according to taste
  • Broad beans you can cook in steam / pressure cook for 2 whistles
  • If you store in refrigerator, It will be good for 2 days
Check Out my other curry recipes:
  • Cabbage Stir Fry || Side Dish || Rice / Roti
  • Ivy Gourd fry/ Dondakaya fry/ Tindora fry
  • Spinach Stir Fry || South Indian Style
  • Kadai Chole/ Chana Masala || Punjabi Style
  • Cauliflower/Gobi Butter Masala || Side Dish || Restaurant Style 🙂

title: The Real Neat Blog 🏅Award
content:
Today this is an unexpected surprise for me 😀 I'm so much happy and I have been nominated by Raneem for the real neat blog award I heartfully thank you for the nomination. She loves cooking, travelling and well explained every post you can explore more about her blog link follows: https://culinarycravings.blog/ The ‘rules’ of the Real Neat Blog Award are: (feel free not to act upon them if you don’t have time; or don’t accept awards; etc.) 1. Put the award logo on your blog. 2. Answer 7 questions asked by the person who nominated you. 3. Thank the people who nominated you, linking to their blogs. 4. Nominate any number of bloggers you like, linking to their blogs. 5. Let them know you nominated them (by commenting on their blog etc.) My Answers to the questions asked by her: 1. what was the thought process before starting your blog? Cooking makes me happy so I got a thought of sharing my recipes to others, blog idea is given by Brother and Hubby. After that I explored and created my own blog 😀🎊 2. What is the most thing you are grateful for ? Frankly saying I never thought I'm great or heard of it, might be I haven't done anything great 😉 But most of people who are close to me said I have lots of patience 😊 3.What is your biggest pet peeve? If someone repeatedly saying same thing more than 2 times.. 😏 4. How do you deal with writer block (when you are stuck and can’t think of something to write)? So simple, I will think twice or thrice if I can't able to get what to write.. give some rest to your brain and start with fresh mind ☺️ Then see what happens 5. What are three tips you would give for a starting blog? I'm a new bee in this blogging world, I started my blog since 5 months learnt few things hope it's useful and helpful to all new friends/ Bloggers
  1. Share atleast 3 Posts in a week ( if you have time )
  2. Be interactive with other bloggers ( Friendly nature )
  3. Maintain attractive photography/ poems/ recipes/ anything and wholeheartedly explain about your each post
6. what is one thing you would change about your life at the moment? I want to explore more about space 🚀 if I have powers 😉  I will go to space and want to find out root cause of creation of everything on earth ( I know it's impossible 😞) 7. Do you feel like blogging opened up more opportunities in your life? I say yes, might be others got any opportunity. I'm enjoying blogging and sharing 😊 My Nominees are:

title: Garlic Butter Naan 😋 | 2 ways (Baked / On tawa)| Indian fluffy flat bread | Breakfast/ Dinner | Weekend Special
content:
Breakfast/ Dinner : Garlic Butter Naan: India  Servings: 5 Duration: 2 hrs for resting dough + 20 mins to cook Naan  Naan is one type of roti making it out of all purpose flour it goes well with any Gravy curry or Dal with butter. It is a big hit in North India slowly propagated all over India. It is an Indian fluffy flatbread which is super delicious and it's famous in any Indian restaurants. You will get frozen Naan too but I prefer homemade or in restaurants when I was bit lazy/ parties/ occasions 🎂 Why I prepared and posted Garlic Butter Naan ? Chela is One of my best followers, she loves Indian food and huge fan of Garlic Butter Naan one day she asked me to make Garlic Butter Naan recipe, actually it's my pleasure to do. So today I presented two ways of making Garlic Butter Naan they are super yum and easy to make, checkout step by step process to understand easily. Hope you like them chela 😊 So my dear followers if you want to learn or know any vegetarian recipe, Please mention in comments section.. I will do my best and share in my upcoming posts. Naan you can also make with wheat flour or both all purpose flour and wheat flour I post them in my upcoming recipes. One dough which I prepared is easy and you could make three types of Naan. They are: Naan: 
  • Take one part of dough
  • Roll it in oval shape
  • Apply some water to back side of Naan & put wet side on hot tawa
  • Cook both sides
  • Naan is ready
Butter Naan:
  • Take one part of dough
  • Roll it in oval shape
  • Apply some water to back side of Naan & put wet side on hot tawa
  • Brush it with melted Butter
  • Cook both sides
  • Butter Naan is ready
Garlic Butter Naan:
  • Take one part of dough
  • Roll it in oval shape
  • Sprinkle garlic & sesame seeds and press gently with hands
  • Roll it once again
  • Apply some water to back side of Naan & put wet side on hot tawa
  • Brush it with melted Butter
  • Cook both sides
  •  Garlic Butter Naan is ready
Detailed Garlic Butter Naan is explained below: Ingredients:
  • All purpose flour/ Maida - 320 gms
  • Salt - 1 tsp
  • Sugar - 1/2 tb sp
  • Curd - 120 ml
  • Fast rising Yeast - 1 pack - 7 gms
  • Baking powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Oil - 1 tb sp
Toppings: 
  • Garlic cloves - peeled off - 10 - Finely chopped
  • Sesame seeds - 1/2 tb sp - ( white/ Black )
  • Cilantro - 1/2 cup - finely chopped ( I'm out of it.. so not used in recipe if available to you its best to add )
  • Butter - melted - 3 tb sp
Procedure: Process of making Basic Dough of Naan:
  • In a mixing bowl add all purpose flour
  • Make a small well at center
  • Add yeast and 3 tb sp Lukewarm water
  • Let it sit for 5 mins
  • Next add salt, sugar, baking powder, curd and oil
  • Mix well
  • Don't knead the dough
  • Apply oil on dough and rest it for 2 hours by closing with a lid / kitchen towel
  • After 2 hours , dough doubles in size
  • Punch in and make dough to round shape
  • Divide dough into equal parts
Step by step process shown below with pictures: Process of making Baked Garlic Butter Naan:
  • Take one part of dough
  • Put it on rolling board / tile by dusting with some flour
  • Roll it upwards by using rolling pin, it should looks like an oval shape
  • Sprinkle garlic & sesame seeds on rolled Naan
  • press seeds gently with hands
  • Again, roll it to stick garlic and sesame seeds on Naan
  • Brush Garlic Naan with butter ( Double coat )
  • Grease a pizza tray with butter
  • Put rolled garlic Butter Naan on it
  • Place the pizza tray in oven
  • Preheat 450 F / 232 C bake it upto 8 mins
  • After 8 mins, carefully take out pizza tray from oven with hand gloves ( to avoid heat )
  • Again brush it with butter
  • Baked Garlic Butter Naan is ready 😉😋
  • Serve immediately with any Gravy curry
Step by step process shown below with pictures: Process of making Garlic Butter Naan on tawa:
  • Take one part of dough
  • Put it on rolling board / tile by dusting with some flou
  • Roll it upwards by using rolling pin, it should looks like an oval shape
  • Sprinkle garlic & sesame seeds on rolled Naan
  • press seeds gently with hands
  • Again, roll it to stick garlic and sesame seeds on Naan
  • Heat tawa over medium to high heat
  • Take it in your hands & turn apply some water on it
  • Put the wet side of Naan on tawa
  • Apply butter on Garlic Naan
  • Bubbles started and puffs up
  • Flip and cook other side
  • Garlic Butter Naan is ready on tawa
  • Serve immediately with any Gravy curry
  • Happy cooking & Enjoy your day🙂
Step by step process shown below with pictures: Note:
  • Adjust salt according to taste
  • If you doesn't like to use yeast then replace it with 1/2 tsp of baking soda and rest of the ingredients are same
  • While rolling Naan if it is sticky to hand or to rolling pin, apply some oil to hands / rolling pin. It works out and won't stick to hands / rolling pin
  • Double the ingredients to increase quantity
  • Dont add so much of water , first mix with 3 tb sp lukewarm water & curd. If required add water otherwise don't add water
  • Actually, here electric stove so I cooked Naan like roti, if you're using gas stove then flip the tawa with Naan towards gas so it bubbles up with nice brown color ( if you're not sure how to make don't trail on gas stove )
  • While serving Butter Naan/ Garlic Butter Naan, again brush it with melted butter to make it rich, fresh and shiny 😉👌
Difference between baked and tawa garlic butter naan?
  • Baked Garlic Butter Naan turned out crisp outside, soft and Fluffy inside
  • Garlic Butter Naan on tawa turned out soft in inside, outside and texture too 🙂
  • Simply I like to say both are super delicious 😋
Checkout my curry recipes for Naan/ Garlic Butter Naan/ Butter Naan/ Roti links shown below:
  • Cauliflower/Gobi Butter Masala || Side Dish || Restaurant Style 🙂
  • Spinach-peas Gravy / Palak Mutter Creamy Kadai
  • Cabbage Stir Fry || Side Dish || Rice / Roti
  • Spinach Stir Fry || South Indian Style

title: Munagakku Podi/ Drumstick Leaves 🍃 Powder || Instant || Side dish
content:
Side Dish: Munagakku Podi: South India  Servings: 15 tb sp spoon's Duration: 30 mins In South India there are many delicious and traditional recipes which can be made out of leafy vegetables and curries with vegetables. Leafy vegetables is good for health if you take it in your daily meal either raw or cooked. Raw😟 Yes you read correct some of the leafy vegetables you can eat directly by adding them in salad 🥗 or in curries. They are spinach, cilantro, parsley, rosemary, lettuce, kale etc., let's see how it helps and usages... For example: coriander or cilantro you can have it on any salad, dressing, curries, Dal or Sambar etc.,Take one more example spinach, yes you can eat it directly or stir fry on salad or curries or with rice Next lettuce, wow such a beautiful leaf and juicy too. Many of you ate burger right in it they add lettuce in burger 🍔 isn't it tasty? My suggstion if you haven't had these three leafy vegetables directly in salad or any curry do try I hope sure you will like them. Most important healthy and works out full in your tummy 😉 Coming to Recipe today I'm using leafy vegetable that is drumstick leaves. These leaves are rich in vitamin A & C and also contains high protein along with little bitterness. So what I thought is to eat this drumstick leaves in my daily meal so I prepared a blended powder out of it by adding spices and dal. It is a prior side dish in any South Indian breakfast recipes and it is an authentic gunpowder or Podi. Nutrition facts of drumstick leaves: Drumstick leaves: Vitamins A & C . Minerals iron, calcium and high protein Urad Dal: Vitamin B6 and rich in iron, calcium, magnesium, potassium, fiber, sodium and protein Bengal Gram: Vitamin A. Minerals iron, calcium, magnesium, sodium and protein Let's start with Ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients:
  • Drumstick leaves - 150 gms
  • Urad Dal - 2 tb sp
  • Bengal Gram - 2 tb sp
  • Dry Red Chillies - 4 to 5
  • Tamarind - 1 tsp
  • Jaggery powder - 2 tb sp
  • Salt - 1/2 tb sp
  • Oil - 1 tb sp
Procedure: Prepreparation:
  • Wash drumstick leaves twice
  • Let them dry on paper towel/ kitchen towel
  • Don't dry them under sun light
Process of making Munagakku Podi:
  • Heat skillet pan over medium heat
  • Add 1 tsp oil
  • Add Urad Dal, Bengal gram & dry Red chillies
  • Roast till golden brown
  • Turn off heat and add dry coconut powder
  • Saute and Keep it aside
  • Let it become cool
  • Next, again remaining oil in skillet pan
  • Add drumstick leaves
  • Roast them till crisp and color changes to dark green color
  • Turn off heat and Let leaves become cool
  • Now, add all roasted ingredients, salt, jaggery and tamarind in blender
  • Blend them till smooth powder
  • Munagakku Podi is ready
  • Take out blended powder in an airtight container
  • Happy cooking 🙂 Enjoy your day 😊
Step by step process shown below with pictures: Note:
  • Adjust spices according to taste
  • If you doesn't like drumstick leaves, you can replace it with curry leaves or mint leaves. Rest of the process and spices is same
  • It preserves upto one month
Checkout my other Podi Recipes:
  • Idly/ Dosa podi / Powder 😋 || Tamilnadu recipe
  • Spicy Coconut Gunpowder/ Kobbari karam
  • Spicy Roasted chickpea Powder / Pappula podi / Bhuna Chana powder

title: Onion Bonda || Instant || Tea-Time/ Evening Snack || Winter Treat ❄️
content:
Evening/ Tea time snack : Onion Bonda : South India  Servings: 25 Bonda's ( mini ) Duration: 15 mins Most of the people like to have a cup of tea with snacks and it should be fried. Kids and adults love to have tasty and crispy snacks everyday or weekly once at home/ outside. So today I thought of making simple and easy snack recipe is Onion Bonda. It is deep fried in oil which contains Bengal gram flour, onions, green chillies paste and salt, mix well together and fry in oil. Ready to serve, see such a simple and handy ingredients at home. Sometimes it best to make simple snacks at home, it's worth and hygiene too. Onion Bonda goes well with Sambar rice, Dal rice, Bottle Gourd curry with yogurt which i posted yesterday. Today, I prepared Onion Bonda with spices and flour which turned out super yummy 😋 Let's start with ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients:
  • Besan Flour - 200 gms
  • Rice Flour - 60 gms
  • White Onions - 2 - medium - Finely/ roughly chopped
  • Green chillies - 5 - blend into smooth paste
  • Turmeric powder - 1/4 tsp
  • Baking soda - 1/4 tsp
  • Salt - 1 tsp
  • Coriander leaves - chopped - 1/2 cup
  • Water - 1/4 cup
  • Oil - to deep fry
Procedure:
  • Take a mixing bowl
  • Add besan flour, rice flour, turmeric powder, salt, baking soda, onions, coriander leaves
  • Mix well
  • Meanwhile, heat oil over medium heat to deep fry
  • Add water in bowl and mix well
  • Drop a small ball of dough to check oil is hot or not.
  • If the dough floats in oil and color changes to golden brown means oil is hot
  • Now carefully drop small amount of dough in oil to fry
  • Slightly move onion bonda with ladle
  • Take out them on a paper towel when they turned out golden brown and crisp
  • Onion bonda is ready
  • Serve hot at evening/ winter season ❄️
  • Happy Cooking and enjoy your day 🙂
Step by step process shown below with pictures: Note:
  • Adjust spices according to taste
  • Double the ingredients to increase the quantity
  • Serve Onion bonda with mint chutney/ sweet chutney / tomato sauce. You can checkout mint & sweet chutneys I shared in previous post
  • Baking soda added to make bonda crispy and soft. If you don't like to add baking soda you can avoid and  add 1 tb sp of roasted peanuts powder
